sentences.sContent: Mayer, for example, notes that women have more opportunities in Silicon Valley because there’s no entrenched hierarchy there.
sentences.sContent_eng: Mayer, for example, notes that women have more opportunities in Silicon Valley because there’s no entrenched hierarchy there.
sentences.sCn: 例如，迈尔解释说，在硅谷女人拥有更多的机会，因为那里没有根深蒂固的官僚结构。

sentences.sContent: He praised her ability to fight corruption and “entrenched bureaucracy,” and cited her working-class roots and her ability to understand the problems of working people.
sentences.sContent_eng: He praised her ability to fight corruption and “entrenched bureaucracy,” and cited her working-class roots and her ability to understand the problems of working people.
sentences.sCn: 他赞扬了佩林打击腐败和"根深蒂固的官僚主义"的能力，并提到她植根于工薪阶层并能够了解其面临的问题。

synos.tran: 根深蒂固的；确立的，不容易改的
确立；保证；挖掘壕沟（entrench的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: strongly established and not likely to change — often used to show disapproval
